segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP

segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP

segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP

segment.source: Use the following procedure to configure the App-V Desktop Client for proper Windows XP credentials.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to configure the App-V Desktop Client for proper Windows XP credentials.

segment.source: After finishing this procedure, the non-domain joined client can perform a publishing refresh without being joined to a domain.
segment.target: After finishing this procedure, the non-domain joined client can perform a publishing refresh without being joined to a domain.

segment.source: To assign the proper credentials for App-V clients running Windows XP
segment.target: To assign the proper credentials for App-V clients running Windows XP

segment.source: With administrator privileges on the App-V Client running Windows XP, open the User Accounts control panel (Classic Control Panel).
segment.target: With administrator privileges on the App-V Client running Windows XP, open the User Accounts control panel (Classic Control Panel).

segment.source: Click the Advanced Tab, and select Manage Passwords.
segment.target: Click the Advanced Tab, and select Manage Passwords.

segment.source: On the Stored User Names and Passwords screen, click Add.
segment.target: On the Stored User Names and Passwords screen, click Add.

segment.source: On the Logon Information Properties screen, fill out the following fields with information from the App-V infrastructure:
segment.target: On the Logon Information Properties screen, fill out the following fields with information from the App-V infrastructure:

segment.source: Server: Name of publishing server external name.
segment.target: Server: Name of publishing server external name.

segment.source: User name: User name for external user in the form Domainusername.
segment.target: User name: User name for external user in the form Domainusername.

segment.source: Password: Password for the user account entered in the User name field.
segment.target: Password: Password for the user account entered in the User name field.

segment.source: The credentials will be stored on the client.
segment.target: The credentials will be stored on the client.

segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista
